title: Civil Aviation Authority (Search and Rescue) Regulations, 2020

IN EXERCISE of the powers contained in section 78 of the Civil
AviationAuthorityAct,2012,thefollowingRegulationsaremade:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Civil Aviation
Title
Authority(SearchandRescue)Regulations,2020.
2. TheseRegulationsapplyto— Application
(a)aircraft requiringsearch and rescue services;
(b)personsororganisationsresponsibleforthemaintenance
and operation of search and rescue services in the
Republicandinareasoverthelandandterritorialwaters
towhichtheRepublichasjurisdictionasspecifiedinthe
regionalairnavigationplan;and
(c) cross border search and rescue services where the
Republichasreciprocalarrangements.

certaintythatanaircraftandthe
aircraft’s occupants are threatened by grave andimminent

equipmentsuitablefortheefficientconductofsearchand

“search and rescue region” means an area of defined
dimensions,associatedwithacentre,withinwhichsearch
and rescue services are provided, and “SRR” shall be
construedaccordingly;

distress, monitoring, communication, coordination and
searchandrescuefunctions,initialmedicalassistanceor

resources,includingcooperatingaircraft,vesselsandother
craftandinstallations;

existsastothesafetyofanaircraftanditsoccupants;and
“vessel”meansawaternavigablecraftofanytype,whether
selfpropelledornot.

Functionsof 5. (1) The Organisation shall assist aircrafts that are in
Organisation distress or missing and are in need of search and rescue for the

and the conduct of search and rescueoperations

centres;

anychangeintheirreadinessorcapability;and

Procedures 26. (1) Wheremultiplesearchandrescuefacilitiesareengaged

(2) Where apilot incommandobservesthatanother aircraft

leave the scene or advised by the centre that it is no
